title: Why do the Greeks think highly of themselves, is it because of history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Exceptionalism. Even the most wretched and underdeveloped tribe would believe they are superior to all other humans. Because Romans believed that Greek culture was the root of their own, their intellectuals highly regarded Greece. While many Romans mocked the squabbling and corruption of their Eastern neighbor using the derogatory term “Greco” (instead of Hellen), Greek studies were nevertheless part of an educated person’s curriculum. Later, Renaissance continued the trend. Later still, the confrontation between scientists and the Latin speaking Catholic Church, led the former to principally use Ancient Greek for their naming protocols.  -Father, did we turn on the lights of Western civilization? -Yes my child, we Greeks turned them on. But why do you ask? -They just sent us the electricity bill…

Yes. Their cultural history mostly that, directly or indirectly, decisively influenced a great part of the world for almost 2 millennial, their contribution to the arts and sciences as well. The fact that they managed to stay ‘on the right side of history’, that their concepts on almost every field of human understanding determined the shape of the world (well, most of it) we live in, even today. Also, because they proved inept to the ‘noble’ causes of committing mass atrocities and genocides, destroying monuments, burning books and libraries, counterfeiting history; in contrast to some of their neighbors and/or historical adversaries who excelled at these worthy achievements. I see some people give bland, politically correct, answers of the type ‘all people are proud blah blah blah’; have you ever read a politically correct answer that states ‘the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth’?
